DOC.brief_summary: The hypothesis is that patients with poorly controlled diabetes would have greater improvement in their blood sugar control when managed by a clinical pharmacist than when managed with usual medical care. Patients with poor control are randomized to pharmacist management or to usual medical care for one year.
DOC.criteria: Age 18 years or older A1c greater than or equal to 9.0 Not expected to live for the duration of the study Managed by an endocrinologist Unwillingness to participate and attend pharmacist visits
